SEARCH
Package Service

Class FoodService

java.lang.Object
Service.FoodService
public class FoodService extends Object
The FoodService class provides methods to handle food-related functionalities such as retrieving food items, updating food information, and adding new food items.
Since:
March 28, 2024
Version:
1.1
Author:
Mingzi Xu

    Constructs a new FoodService object and initializes DAO instances.

  • Constructor Details

    • FoodService

      public FoodService()
      Constructs a new FoodService object and initializes DAO instances.

  • Method Details

    • getFoodList

      public List<FoodVo> getFoodList(String userType, int uid, String storeId)
      Retrieves a list of food items based on the user type, user ID, and store ID.
      Parameters:
      userType - The type of user (e.g., "customer", "admin").
      uid - The user ID.
      storeId - The ID of the store.
      Returns:
      A list of FoodVo objects representing the retrieved food items.

    • getFoodById

      public FoodVo getFoodById(int fid)
      Retrieves information about a specific food item by its ID.
      Parameters:
      fid - The ID of the food item.
      Returns:
      A FoodVo object representing the retrieved food item.

    • updateFood

      public int updateFood(Food food)
      Updates information about a food item in the database. If the food item is marked as expired, it sends an email notification to subscribers and deletes their subscriptions.
      Parameters:
      food - The Food object containing the updated information.
      Returns:
      The number of rows affected in the database after the update operation.

    • addFood

      public int addFood(Food food, int uid)
      Adds a new food item to the database. Retrieves the store ID based on the user ID and sets it for the food item.
      Parameters:
      food - The Food object representing the new food item to be added.
      uid - The ID of the user adding the food item.
      Returns:
      The number of rows affected in the database after the insertion operation.
